args:
Though the play is canceled, Laxi refuses to
give up and decides to write the rest of the
script herself. When Laxi asks Sylas if he could
truly throw away an almost-complete heart, he
is touched by her speech and heads off to save
Shelley with a new aromatic.
▷The theater's gone on to a different\nplay, which means ours is done.◁
▷We never got to see the heart that\nMarley so wanted to show everyone.◁
There's still more we can do.
...By my sainted cap and bells! You still\nwant to perform Marley's play?!
Affirmative. The set and the actors are\nalmost complete, which means we merely\nneed an ending for the script.
Well, seeing as how our new production\nisn't ready yet, I suppose I could find a\nway to squeeze you in...
Er, but I hear Marley is still holed up\nin his home.
Such surroundings are not conducive to\nfinishing a script of any quality, I fear.
Ah, Laxi. Apologies for the outburst.\nI'm just having a difficult time\nconcentrating on my research.
I guess what happened to Marley and his\nsister had an effect on me—though not as\nmuch as it did him, of course.
▷The two of you have a lot in common.\nIt's no surprise you would be affected.◁
Yes, I know all too well the pain of having\none's hard work amount to nothing.
And besides, I gave both him and Shelley\nmy healing aromatics.
They've worked on that illness before,\nso why aren't they effective now?
I swore to help them, and yet here we are.\nI'm just so ashamed.
▷Please don't be so hard on yourself.◁
Yes, I know now's not the time to be down.\nWe have to help clean up now that the\nplay has been canceled.
Negative. We do not have to do that.\nI want you to go on stage instead.
Er, sorry. How do I do that, exactly?
I have spoken with the owner. If the script\nis complete, we can perform.
So I will write it myself.
YOU'RE going to write the script?!\nCan you even do that?
I have no experience, so success is\nuncertain. But I will do it.

You've got to be kidding... I know there's
only a little left to write, but the final
scene is the one that will leave a lasting
impression with the audience.
So I should give up because it's difficult?
Would you be satisfied with that?\nWith never seeing this completed?
There's a heart almost ready to dwell\nwithin this script...within this play.
But it's being canceled and thrown away\nlike it's nothing. Is that because it's not\nalive?
You and Marley both created something in\norder to save something important to you.
Is this play not important, then?
▷Easy, Laxi. There's no need to put that\nkind of pressure on Sylas right now.◁
▷But if I can say something, Sylas, Laxi\nis more excited about finishing this play\nthan I can ever remember seeing her.◁
▷She believes that finishing it will help\nus understand what Maestro felt when he\ncreated us.◁
▷So right now, she's grieving the loss of\nthe art that Marley put his heart into.\nDoes that make sense?◁
Of course... You yourselves are\nsomeone's creation.
It must have been very painful for you\nto see a work abandoned like that.
I'm fine. But the heart within this play is\nwaiting to be completed.
I know this because my heart\nwas completed by Maestro.
So I'm going to write the rest of the play\nbased on the story Marley told me.
Plus...if creating things can save people...
Then if I create something, maybe I too\ncan gain the power to save someone.

I can save you from your sadness.
I can save Marley from his despair.
And I can save Shelley as she fights for
her life.
Thank you, Laxi. You've opened my eyes.
If I want to save someone, I can't sit here\nfeeling sorry for myself. I must take action.

To the sylvan forest. I'm going to gather
all the medicinal herbs that may be able
to help Shelley's illness, no matter how
far it has progressed.
▷You're going to create a new aromatic\nto save her?◁
If my creation has the possibility to save\nsomeone, then I must give my all to the\nendeavor. Isn't that right, Laxi?
Sylas...thank you.\nOperation acknowledged. I will write the\nscript and await your return.
We're going to save Shelley, and we're\ngoing to save Marley.
And we'll save the heart that lies\nwithin this play!
